The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

actionId.description: The element id of the related action.

relationship.description: The relationship of this action to the related action.

offsetDuration.description: A duration or range of durations to apply to the relationship. For example, 30-60 minutes before.

offsetRange.description: A duration or range of durations to apply to the relationship. For example, 30-60 minutes before.

timingDateTime.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

timingAge.description: A duration of time during which an organism (or a process) has existed.

value.description: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

comparator.description: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

unit.description: A human-readable form of the unit.

system.description: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

code.description: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

timingPeriod.description: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

end.description: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means no end was known or planned at the time the instance was created. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.

value.description: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

comparator.description: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

unit.description: A human-readable form of the unit.

system.description: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

code.description: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

timingRange.description: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.

low.description: The low limit. The boundary is inclusive.

high.description: The high limit. The boundary is inclusive.

timingTiming.description: Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are planned, expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds, and may be used for reporting the schedule to which past regular activities were carried out.

event.description: Identifies specific times when the event occurs.

repeat.description: A set of rules that describe when the event is scheduled.

code.description: A code for the timing schedule (or just text in code.text). Some codes such as BID are ubiquitous, but many institutions define their own additional codes. If a code is provided, the code is understood to be a complete statement of whatever is specified in the structured timing data, and either the code or the data may be used to interpret the Timing, with the exception that .repeat.bounds still applies over the code (and is not contained in the code).

participant.description: Indicates who should participate in performing the action described.

items.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

type.description: The type of participant in the action.

role.description: The role the participant should play in performing the described action.

type.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

groupingBehavior.description: Defines the grouping behavior for the action and its children.

selectionBehavior.description: Defines the selection behavior for the action and its children.

requiredBehavior.description: Defines the required behavior for the action.

precheckBehavior.description: Defines whether the action should usually be preselected.

cardinalityBehavior.description: Defines whether the action can be selected multiple times.

definitionCanonical.description: A reference to an ActivityDefinition that describes the action to be taken in detail, or a PlanDefinition that describes a series of actions to be taken.

definitionUri.description: A reference to an ActivityDefinition that describes the action to be taken in detail, or a PlanDefinition that describes a series of actions to be taken.

transform.description: A URI that is a reference to a canonical URL on a FHIR resource

dynamicValue.description: Customizations that should be applied to the statically defined resource. For example, if the dosage of a medication must be computed based on the patient's weight, a customization would be used to specify an expression that calculated the weight, and the path on the resource that would contain the result.

items.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

path.description: The path to the element to be customized. This is the path on the resource that will hold the result of the calculation defined by the expression. The specified path SHALL be a FHIRPath resolveable on the specified target type of the ActivityDefinition, and SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and a restricted subset of functions. The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](fhirpath.html#simple) for full details).

expression.description: An expression specifying the value of the customized element.

action.description: Sub actions that are contained within the action. The behavior of this action determines the functionality of the sub-actions. For example, a selection behavior of at-most-one indicates that of the sub-actions, at most one may be chosen as part of realizing the action definition.

prefix.description: A user-visible prefix for the action.

title.description: The title of the action displayed to a user.

description.description: A brief description of the action used to provide a summary to display to the user.

textEquivalent.description: A text equivalent of the action to be performed. This provides a human-interpretable description of the action when the definition is consumed by a system that might not be capable of interpreting it dynamically.

priority.description: Indicates how quickly the action should be addressed with respect to other actions.

code.description: A code that provides meaning for the action or action group. For example, a section may have a LOINC code for the section of a documentation template.

reason.description: A description of why this action is necessary or appropriate.

documentation.description: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the action that can be provided to the CDS recipient. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.

goalId.description: Identifies goals that this action supports. The reference must be to a goal element defined within this plan definition.

subjectCodeableConcept.description: A code or group definition that describes the intended subject of the action and its children, if any.

subjectReference.description: A code or group definition that describes the intended subject of the action and its children, if any.

output.description: Defines the outputs of the action, if any.
